definition: to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: At that time, the public order in Dingxiang was very chaotic.
sentences.chinese: 当时定襄的社会治安十分混乱。

sentences.english: On the U. S. -Japan relationship, Japanese politics are in disarray.
sentences.chinese: 在美日关系上，日本政见十分混乱。

sentences.english: Behaviour that may be rational for individual actors can cause chaos if everyone copies it.
sentences.chinese: 个人合理的行为，若是每个人都照样做就会造成混乱。

sentences.english: I twisted round and went to slam on the brakes, but in my confusion hit the accelerator a second time.
sentences.chinese: 我扭过身，猛地踩刹车，但是混乱中我又踩了油门。

sentences.english: "There's always a lot of confusion, but we're used to it, " says Livia Savarese, 23, a Naples psychology student and part-time social-services worker.
sentences.chinese: 这里一直有许多的混乱，但是我们已经习以为常。

sentences.english: Identification of the Chinese drug Malanye and its adulterants.
sentences.chinese: 中药马蓝叶及其混乱品的比较鉴别。

sentences.english: PART of making money in this topsy-turvy world is to see the opportunities others don't.
sentences.chinese: 在这个混乱的世界赚钱，就要看到别人没发现的机会。

sentences.english: Yet this latest pause in Pakistan’s political turmoil is likely to be brief.
sentences.chinese: 然而在巴政治混乱中这次最新的停顿被看作是短暂的。

sentences.english: The sheep started to run amok and the kids too.
sentences.chinese: 羊儿们开始横冲直撞，孩子们也如此一片混乱。

sentences.english: Too abused extrusions also add to this chaotic feeling.
sentences.chinese: 过度使用挤出也给这个模型增添了些混乱的感觉。

sentences.english: Everywhere he goes, he causes chaos , making his fans split their sides with laughter.
sentences.chinese: 无论他走到哪里都制造混乱，使他的粉丝们笑破肚皮。

sentences.english: Your mother will bawl you out when she sees this mess.
sentences.chinese: 当你母亲看到这混乱的局面时她会责骂你的。

sentences.english: The confusion caused by the traffic order is inefficient because of traffic.
sentences.chinese: 这些混乱的交通秩序是造成交通效率低下的原因。

sentences.english: His interference spilt over into confusion.
Bladeling PCs may be any non-chaotic alignment.
sentences.chinese: 刀锋怪玩家可以成为任何非混乱阵营。

sentences.english: Why are “web standards” so frigging messed up?

definition: variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
chaotic warfare/confused fighting/melee/to join in such fighting
to get into disarray/to get out of whack
disordered and in a mess (idiom); all mixed up and chaotic
